column4: I'm sorry, I'm busy here with work outside of IRC.  Perhaps someone else here can help.
okay. thanks anyway

Please take a look at http://apt.alturl.com/ enter your version of Ubuntu, which architecture (probably i386), and vlc as the package you need to install.  If you have Ubuntu installed you can should enter ubuntu-desktop in the last textbox.  That will give you all the packages you need to download to install vlc on another computer.
i found vlc-data, libvlccore2, libvlc2, vlc-nox, and vlc. u want me to download all those deb?
and i already did that.. i installed 4 of them, and now there is problem with installing vlc-nox..
I get a much larger list of packages if I use that url that I gave you.
u want me to install all of them?
Yes, those are all the dependencies that VLC requires.
OMG !
isn't there is a easy way?
Not if you don't have an internet connection on that computer, sorry.
Those are all the packages that would be installed if you did 'apt-get install vlc' on a computer that did have internet access.
well trying now.. pray... :(
how to install all of those.. i have to double click every file one by one?
The easiest way is to put them all in one folder, then from a terminal: sudo dpkg -i /path/to/files/*.deb
okay.. IdleOne yes
* = folder name?
you there?
Hello, I am here to thank you.
The solution you suggested me yesterday.... it worked
I gotta go now. I am kinda sad :(.. so sorry
You'll need to provide us with the URL that the pastebin gives you.
I know
Okay :)
